sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Following the weekend execution of an Iranian-Swedish man for alleged terrorism, two further prisoners are reported to have been put to death by Iranian authorities, this time for blasphemy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Yusuf Mered and Saladaf Azizi Zair were hanged at a prison in central Iran. They had been accused of insulting the Prophet Muhammad and promoting atheism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The latest judicial killings continue an upward trend of executions in which the condemned have been mainly opponents of Iran's religious regime and ethnic minorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Last month a report by Western NGOs revealed a dramatic surge in the application of the death penalty in the Islamic Republic last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: 582 people were put to death for a range of alleged crimes, placing it second in the rankings of countries that use capital punishment. The increase coincides with months of anti-regime protests and a subsequent bloody crackdown that has left hundreds dead and many more jailed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Chile's ultra-conservative Republican Party will be tasked with drafting a new constitution to replace the one inherited from Augusto Pinochet's dictatorship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Republican Party won 35% of Sunday's vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In a major blow for centre-left President Gabriel Boric, the coalition he leads only won 29% of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: More than 15.1 million Chileans went to the polls on Sunday to elect 50 members from 350 candidates to form the Constitutional Council, which will propose a new constitution for the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This is the second attempt at rewriting the country's fundamental laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: At the beginning of September 2022, Chileans rejected a first proposal for a new constitution by 61.9%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: As Turkey's election campaign enters its final week, tensions are mounting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, the campaign bus of Istanbul's mayor Ekrem İmamoğlu was vandalized while he was giving a speech in Erzurum, a stronghold of incumbent President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's AK party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As İmamoğlu addressed his supporters from the top of an open-air bus, some members of the crowd threw stones at him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Istanbul, President Erdogan held his campaign's largest rally so far, speaking to a crowd of more than one and a half million people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The president appealed to his conservative Muslim voter base and slammed his opponent, Kemal Kilic Daroglu, calling him a drunk and an infidel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Opinion polls show the two candidates neck and neck, representing Erdogan's biggest electoral challenge in his two decades in power.

sentences.sentence: Commonwealth. God save the King. The extended coronation weekend continues for Brits today with what's being called the big help out. The aim is to use volunteering to bring communities together and create a lasting community service legacy stemming from the historic occasion.
